Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
06/02/2020. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Implementation Sustainability Exit Plan
(ISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the ISEP and your contract. As indicated above substantial compliance has
been established therefore, your license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
1.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following: In
compliance.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following: In compliance.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Optimist House last environmental inspection was completed on 04/18/2018.
The environmental inspection is overdue because of Covid-19. Optimist House
has 90 days after the executive stay at home order is lifted to complete an
environmental inspection with rating of A.
 Two of four employee files reviewed did not have a current tuberculosis
screening test due to Covid-19. Employees have 90 days after the executive
stay at home order is lifted to complete a tuberculosis screening test with a
negative result.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 A resident’s incident reports are to be summarized and evaluated in the
progress section of the applicable goal and not summarized in the social work
contact section of the report.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Optimist House submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The corrective action plan is from their
04/29/2019 interim inspection. Optimist House is in compliance with their corrective
action plan because R 400.4122 Staff qualifications by securing current central
registry clearances on their employees is met. Compliance is also met with
R 400.4113 Employee records by completing timely employee performance
evaluations.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
